meanings.definition: Remove clothing or covering from oneself or someone else.
meanings.sent1: She strips off her wet clothes after swimming.
meanings.sent2: He always strips down to his pajamas before bed.
meanings.sent3: The magician strips away the layers of fabric to reveal a hidden object.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, it strips the sky of its vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The wind strips the leaves from the trees in the autumn.

meanings.definition: Long, narrow pieces of material or land.
meanings.sent1: She used strips of paper to make a colorful collage.
meanings.sent2: The farmer planted strips of corn in the field.
meanings.sent3: The cat plays with a long strip of ribbon, chasing it around the room.
meanings.sent4: The river carved a deep strip through the valley over centuries.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted vibrant strips of color across the canvas.

meanings.definition: To remove or take off a covering or layer from something.
meanings.sent1: He carefully strips the old wallpaper from the wall.
meanings.sent2: She strips the bed before putting on fresh sheets.
meanings.sent3: The chef strips the skin from the potatoes with ease.
meanings.sent4: The storm strips the paint from the old wooden fence.
meanings.sent5: The worker strips the damaged roof to prepare for repairs.

meanings.definition: To tear or cut into long, narrow pieces.
meanings.sent1: She strips the paper into thin pieces for the art project.
meanings.sent2: He strips the bark from the tree to use for crafts.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy strips the newspaper into a mess on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The wind can strip the flag into tatters during a storm.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully strips the vegetables into uniform slices.
